text:
Created attachment 31442
jmeter-clipboard-error-message

JMeter Version:
2.11 r1554548

System Info:
Ubuntu 13.10 x64

Java:
java version "1.7.0_51"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0_51-b13)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 24.51-b03, mixed mode)

When we have multiple test cases open with the JMeter gui, we used to be able to copy and paste components from one instance to another. Now every attempt made to copy and paste a component has been met with the following error: `An error occurred while copying node: Owner failed to convert data`.

Attempts to remedy the issue have not worked (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21414435/jmeter-does-not-use-global-clipboard).
creator: son.of.lysander@gmail.com
franojr@o2.pl
text:
Hi,

I tried to reproduce your issue, but I can copy Thread groups, samplers, etc. between jmeter instances with no errors.

I do have even the same java version (jdk 1.7.0_51) and Ubuntu 13.10 x64.
Can you provide more details? Provide simple *.jmx example and specify which elements you are trying to copy. You can also provide your jmeter.properties file.

Do you use some plugins? Make sure that you can reproduce error on clean jmeter.

Hello,
You are using third party plugin as per log:
2014/03/26 11:01:07 INFO  - jmeter.gui.util.MenuFactory: Skipping kg.apc.jmeter.config.VariablesFromCSVFile

There are known issues in some plugins:
- https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/jmeter-plugins/O5h0CA9tZeM

Also there was an issue in a previous release of jmeter-plugins, ensure you move to 1.1.3.

Please try without it and if you reproduce issue, reopen bug.
Thank you

NOTE THAT JMETER-PLUGINS IS A THIRD PARTY PLUGIN, its forum is there:
- https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/jmeter-plugins
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
